rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language ('will be able to eliminate') without high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The segment discusses future potential ('will be able to eliminate'), not realised impact (rule 3).
Segment does not contain a question.
The segment contains a confidence statement from an official: 'we will be able to eliminate this'.
